intro: Agyneia tetrandra, commonly known as the four-threaded agyneia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that are usually pale purple or white in color. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy surface. Agyneia tetrandra is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands, where it thrives in full sun.
